**Category** Monitoring, SIEM **Description** Exporting Azure events allows building better situational awareness when building timelines and audit trails. More advanced analytics can also be performed on exported data (Log Analytics KQL, or other analytics languages) - Logs should be exported at least for period of 90 days, as this allows looking beyond the default 7-30 days of data retained. **Additional details** Source of information (Information from MS docs) - [Azure AD Logs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/reports-monitoring/) - [Azure logs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/essentials/platform-logs-overview#types-of-platform-logs) - [Azure Devops Logs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/audit/azure-devops-auditing?view=azure-devops&tabs=preview-page#export-auditing-events) | Log | Layer | Description | status -|-|-|- ðŸ“œ Azure Active Directory logs | Azure Tenant | Contains the history of sign-in activity and audit trail of changes made in the Azure Active Directory for a particular tenant. | ☐ | ðŸ“œ Activity log |Azure Subscription | Provides insight into the operations on each Azure resource in the subscription from the outside (the management plane) in addition to updates on Service Health events.
